utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmmm. Don’t get up yet. Stay in bed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate. Hi.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you do this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Stop saying ‘what’ and wake up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t … We’re handcuffed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kinky.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, it’s not funny.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I didn’t say funny, I said kinky. And I didn’t cuff us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You think I cuffed us?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, they look like police cuffs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Somebody else did this to us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you recognize this place?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. But if I were writing a book, this is where bad things would happen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: My watch is missing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mine too. And my wallet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So is my badge and my gun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And my phone. I just renewed my contract.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Would you stop joking?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey! Do I begrudge you your coping mechanisms?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s the last thing you remember?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I – It’s kind of a blur.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Me too. I think we were drugged.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I think so, too. And not the good kind.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, lift my top.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think you still might be under the influence, but okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, not like that. Just check my back. There’s something that hurts.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s a needle mark.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We were drugged.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like the work of a pygmy with a blowgun.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, you can put my shirt down.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, sorry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, Castle. I want you to think very hard. What’s the last thing you remember from this morning?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was with you. We were, uh … someplace seedy. A hotel that rents rooms by the hour.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Would you just knock it off?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s where we were. You called me and you asked me to meet you there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, I did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then I took you up to the room and then we …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And then we …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dead body! We went to go see a dead body!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. A dead body.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what I love about working with you? You always take me to the most charming places.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I’m a simple girl, Castle. I go where the bodies are. Besides, for a mystery novelist, aren’t seedy motels kind of a standard?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, yes. As a matter of fact, they’re a veritable advent calendar of salaciousness. Behind every door a delightful tale of desperation, depravity…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or death.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: You need to stop being a control freak.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m not being a control freak!

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: You are being a control freak.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I have never been a control freak. Nobody has ever called me -

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sorry. Are we interrupting?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: No. Victim’s a white male, late 30s.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Housekeeping found him when they came to clean the room.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cause of death?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Not entirely sure yet, but there are indications of asphyxia with some cyanosis around the face.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he was suffocated?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Maybe. Then again, there’s this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So he could have just OD’d, passed out face first, and suffocated.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh no, it’s definitely murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How can you tell?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Someone torched his fingers. Burned off his prints.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They wanted to erase his identity.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, and did a pretty good job, too. His wallet’s missing and we’ve been through the room a couple of times. There’s nothing here to tell us who this guy is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he pay for the room in cash?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. And the clerk said that he registered as Jack Sparrow.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, there’s a possibility that’s his real name.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sure it is.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’re running it … just … in case.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The clerk also said he appeared nervous when he checked in. He uh, kept looking behind him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he have any visitors?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He couldn’t say. Place isn’t the most secure building.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I saw a camera in the lobby.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s a dummy.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It’s not the only one.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s used to scare away drug dealers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, um…. You don’t go to the trouble of trying to erase someone’s identity unless you have a very good reason to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie, what are the chances of us recovering some of the prints?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Depends on how bad the burns are. Let me get him back to the morgue.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, in the meantime, let’s get Ryan to run his photos through missing persons and see if anything pops.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: John Doe in a seedy motel with his fingerprints burned off. How did we get from there to here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, easy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jeez.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Easy. Easy there. Well, I hate to state the obvious, but we’re kind of joined at the hip here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, let’s just stand up. C’mon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you always like this in the morning?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, this is awkward.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They couldn’t just handcuff us Midnight Run style?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Ryan did run our guy through missing persons. And there wasn’t a match. Then what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then … Ryan asked me … if he spent Thanksgiving at his parent’s house did that mean he had to spend Christmas at Jenny’s family’s house.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I’m talking about our case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If you want me to reconstruct it I have to do it in order.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine. Um … burnt fingerprints, suffocated, uh … needle marks?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The morgue. We went to the morgue.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I told you, it’s none of your business.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course it’s none of my business, that’s why I want to know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Know what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What she and Esposito were fighting about.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s none of your business.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s the point.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where are we?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: No ID yet, but his hands have calluses, so most likely he had a job that required physical labor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about fingerprints?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Outer skin is too damaged. But, I may be able to macerate the skin, pull some from the underside of the epidural layer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You can do that?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yes. In some cases. But it’s going to take a couple of days. In the meantime, I did find this. It was tucked in the fold of his pants pocket. It would have been real easy for our killer to miss.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: 147 West 97th Street, 4PM.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: It’s the address of the Canbury Café, half block off Broadway.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: 4PM he was meeting someone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or met someone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, you and Esposito take this up there and see if anyone remembers seeing our victim. Maybe that’ll help us ID him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: On it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was so special about our victim that our killer wanted to erase his identity?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t say spy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or mob hit.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mob hit of a spy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Crazy theories aren’t going to help. Not until we figure out who this guy is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is a postal barcode. Our victim wrote this on the back of an envelope.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A postal barcode?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, those little hash marks you see on mailing labels and envelopes. It’s a way of exactly identifying an address, but in a machine readable way. We get that decoded and we’ll be able to tell exactly where our victim was when he wrote that note.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, then we called the post office and they gave us the address.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The house in Queens.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The house in Queens.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So do you know what Lanie and Esposito were fighting about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Everything. They both want to be together, but neither of them wants to admit to it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ugh … why do people do that to themselves?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe they just don’t see it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How could they not? It’s just so obvious.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is the place?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It matches the address.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It doesn’t look like anybody's home.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hello? NYPD, anybody here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anybody here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bill and Nora Ranford. Maybe Bill is our John Doe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD, identify yourself!

utterance.speaker: RUTH
utterance.content: Help me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ma’am … ma’am, are you okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: An old woman in a cage.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s the last thing I remember.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Me too. What the hell is going on?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s just, I always spend Christmas with my family.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, well… you were the one who decided to get hitched, bro.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, but I didn’t think that meant driving down to Florida to spend the holidays with her grandmother.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Driving? You’re not flying?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: During the holidays? Are you kidding me? Besides, Jenny thinks that a road trip will give us some quality time together.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That is no road trip, brother. That is a relationship test.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Relationship test? We’re getting married in a month.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, we’ll see what happens after the test. It’s the pre-wedding road trip test. Locked together, for hours. That way she can confront you with any lingering doubts she may have about your future together. And you will have nowhere to hide.

utterance.speaker: VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: Hey, have either of you seen Beckett?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She’s probably following up on a lead.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Don’t think that I don’t know that you guys cover for each other.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh… what’s that?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Any progress on our John Doe?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Turns out he did show up at the Canbury Café yesterday and he wasn’t alone.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Waitress recognized immediately. Said he sat in a corner booth, met with a guy, long hair, goatee. Said our vic looked nervous.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We have the waitress working with an artist to see if we can come up with a sketch of the goateed man to use on a canvass.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: All right. Keep me apprised.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: C’mon, Jenny loves me. She wouldn’t test me like that.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right. Just watch out if she wants to take you canoeing.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Canoeing? Canoeing is a test?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s all about power, direction. Like a marriage. If the canoe goes straight, it shows her that you can compromise, work together, find a rhythm, move forward in the same direction. But, if it’s going around in circles? So is your relationship.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, would you just work with me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How about you work with me? How come you always have to lead?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How come you always have to step on my toes?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Since when do I – okay, you know what? Tell me this. Why do you always have to be first? First out of the elevator, first through the door.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um, I am a cop. I’m the one with the gun. Being first through the door is my job.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In the elevator? Look, how ‘bout this? Would it kill you to let someone open the door for you once in a while?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You do realize that if somebody opens the door for me then I will be going through it first anyway, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh yeah, that’s right, I forgot. You have to be the smartest, too. Everything’s a competition with you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That is so not true. Are you always like this in the mornings?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, I’d argue with you but then I’d have to let you win.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine. Go ahead. You lead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you. Where did you want to go?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think that there is a light switch over there. Or do you want to stay in the dark?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I liked it better in the dark.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This door is sealed. There’s no way we’re getting through here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The walls are cinder block.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What do you suppose is in that big freezer? You think it’s the old woman? And what if we’re in some psycho’s lair and we have to kill each other like in Saw?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, stop speculating. It’s not helping.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, c’mon. An old lady in a cage? Us cuffed together in this creepy room? What am I supposed to think?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re supposed to think we need to get the hell out of here before someone comes back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How long do you think we were out?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A couple of hours.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How can you tell?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: ‘Cause I’m hungry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve got some beef jerky.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hold my hand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So that the cuffs don’t cut into us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We could just try to get them off. You got a bobby pin?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is this, the 1940s? These are my police cuffs. You’re not gonna open them with bobby pin. Face it. We’re stuck.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You think anyone knows we’re missing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Martha and Alexis will notice if you don’t go home, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, my mother is taking Alexis on a tour of colleges this weekend. Esposito and Ryan?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, they’ll probably notice, but it doesn’t mean they’ll –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: - find us here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s a hatch.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If we can up get there we might be able to get out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but it’s too high.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not if we climb on top of that.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That was Lanie. Preliminary autopsy report shows that our victim was in fact smothered.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Guy his size, you think he’d put up more of a struggle.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He couldn’t. Tox report showed that his system was flooded with so much sedative that it could put down an elephant.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where are we with that sketch?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, I’ve got unis looking through mug books and I sent a team up town to canvass.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Still not back, huh?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. It’s been hours. Every time I call it goes straight to voicemail.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You think they’re really running down a lead?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What lead? There was nothing new on the board when we came back.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You think you can hit up dispatch? See if they’ll run a trace on the transponder on Beckett’s unit. I want to know where they are.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I can’t get a good angle on it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Here. Try this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You better not be enjoying this, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll let you know in a minute. One, two, three.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Push.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whatever is in here is a hell of a lot heavier than a little old lady.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s like it’s filled with rocks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if we emptied it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s a great idea, Castle, except it’s locked and I’m fresh out of bolt cutters.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but it’s a combo lock.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, when I was writing Storm Rising I studied with one of the best safe crackers in the biz. I can open this. I just don’t know if we want to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s get crackin’, Castle. Before our captors get back.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Transponder says her unit’s right over here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s definitely Beckett’s car.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Looks like it’s been dumped.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Call it in.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Time stamp puts this at 5 hours ago.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But that’s not Castle or Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And he’s not alone.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Someone picked him up.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Do we know who they are?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No clue.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Can we get a plate number?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Too far away.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We also ran Beckett and Castle’s cells. They’re both off grid.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What the hell did Castle get her into?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I want CSU on that car with a fine tooth comb for any possible trace evidence. They were working the John Doe with you. Where could they have gone?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Been over it a dozen times, we still don’t know.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Still no hits on our long haired man from the café.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Do whatever it takes to get an ID on that victim. And find out what in the hell he was into. If Beckett and Castle are still out there, then they’re running out of time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, for God’s sake Castle, how much longer are you going to keep doing this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ugh, I almost had it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, like you had it the last 100 times.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh ye of little faith. You would make a terrible conjoined twin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can I have my hand back?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you got a story to explain all of this? The old woman in a cage? John Doe with his identity removed? Us handcuffed but still alive?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I don’t think that’s a story you want to hear.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With those elements? I can’t think of a version that ends well. Not even a Disney version.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I was afraid of that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The good news is, we’ve been gone long enough they’ve started to look for us by now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: 101st time’s a charm.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: C’mon, Lanie. There’s got to be something else about this guy from his autopsy.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: He was in the beginning stages of heart disease, he had a degenerative hip condition, and mild scoliosis, probably from sitting too much. And the last thing he had to eat was a pastrami sandwich. None of which will get you an ID.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: His hands were calloused suggesting physical labor and yet he spent too much time sitting?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Maybe he drove a fork lift. I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: C’mon! We need something concrete, now.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Then I can’t help you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Lanie, they’re out there! God knows where and what kind of trouble they’re in.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: You don’t think I want to help? They’re my friends, too.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So Beckett said, with enough time, you might be able to recover prints.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yeah, in a couple of days. Why?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What happens if you do it now?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: If could damage the print beyond recognition.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Could. So … it’s possible it might not, right?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We gotta do something.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I did it!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You did it!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How bad can it be? I mean, we’ve seen dead bodies before, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s not a body.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. It’s worse.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Manacles and bloody instruments of torture.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, looks like your crazed, sadistic, psycho killer theory might not be far off, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know whether to be smug or horrified.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I vote for motivated.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right there with you. Let’s get the hell out of here.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Javi.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I can feel your impatience all over my backside. And rushing me is never a good idea.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’re talking about that print, right?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Damn it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It tore. I guess the skin wasn’t softened enough. It’s ruined.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Is any of it usable?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I might be able to salvage some of it from the middle. Why?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So what we did, we were able to join the partials from that scrap of paper with the print pieces that Lanie recovered.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Our victim is Hank Spooner, an independent trucker out of San Antonio. Owns and operates his own rig.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What was he doing in New York?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: According to his folks, he got a contract last week to pick up a load from Del Rio, Texas and bring it to Queens. Last they heard from him was two days ago.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What was the cargo?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All Spooner told them was that he got a last minute call from a special client who was paying him big money.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: His folks also said it was unusual for him to be staying in a motel.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Apparently Spooner never stayed in the city. He thought it was safer and cheaper to stay in his truck.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: We need to find that vehicle. Get an APB out to all the major truck stops. If we’re lucky it may tell us why someone wanted Hank Spooner dead.

utterance.speaker: CHUCK MARTINEZ
utterance.content: I think I might be able to answer that.

utterance.speaker: MARTINEZ
utterance.content: You looking for me? Chuck Martinez, DEA.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: How did you know we were looking for you, Agent Martinez?

utterance.speaker: MARTINEZ
utterance.content: We had Spooner’s files tagged. He’s a person of interest, so I got notified when you ran his prints.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why did you meet with him yesterday?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Your man’s dead, Agent Martinez. And two of my folks are missing. We don’t have time for jurisdictional games, so I’ll ask you again. What’s your interest in Spooner?

utterance.speaker: MARTINEZ
utterance.content: All right. Look, half a dozen times a year Spooner takes a contract from Texas to New York, but he always makes a pickup in Del Rio. It’s a little border town.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You think he’s smuggling drugs from Mexico?

utterance.speaker: MARTINEZ
utterance.content: Cartels are really active in these towns. They’re extremely brutal.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And if you knew Spooner was involved, why didn’t you arrest him?

utterance.speaker: MARTINEZ
utterance.content: All the signs were there, okay? But all we had him on was suspicious activity, and we don’t want the errand boy. We want the people he works for.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: How’d you end up at that café?

utterance.speaker: MARTINEZ
utterance.content: Needed some leverage. So we set up a sting posing as runner looking to hire him to move some product, only Spooner made my guy. Now, instead of running, he wanted to meet. And he was scared. He wanted out and he was afraid of what they would do to him if he walked away. So he agreed to tell us everything if I guaranteed him safety and I took that to my bosses. They agreed.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: But by then he was already dead.

utterance.speaker: MARTINEZ
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: MARTINEZ
utterance.content: So where were your colleagues when they went missing?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We don’t know. We just know they were one the case.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did Spooner say anything to you about the New York operation?

utterance.speaker: MARTINEZ
utterance.content: All he said was, it’s not at all what you think.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Troopers found his semi. Truck stop, north of the city. Let’s go, boys.

utterance.speaker: STATE TROOPER MCNICHOLS
utterance.content: According to truck stop records, the rig’s been parked here for three days. No one’s seen the driver for two. You’re going to want to take a look inside.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s hair. These could be air holes.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey! Over here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s still too high.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not if I climb on your shoulders.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What? We’ve done it before.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, you say that like it was pleasant. And we weren’t handcuffed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who’s got no faith now? C’mon, Castle. We’ve got no idea when they’re coming back or even if they’re coming back at all.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Last time you were wearing sneakers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m going to need your help.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lift up my shirt, pull off my boots … now, under normal circumstances I would like where this was heading.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You can fantasize later, after we get out of the room.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just so you know, not as much fun if I have your permission. How do you run in these things?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Shut up and pull.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Agent Martinez, are you sure these guys were smuggling drugs?

utterance.speaker: MARTINEZ
utterance.content: Ah, if I had answers I’d share.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Captain Gates.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What did you find?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Weigh bills.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Spooner delivered to a furniture store in lower Manhattan two days ago.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Get on it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Call your bosses. Tell them I want all the files on this investigation. I’m getting my people back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: ‘kay, ready?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ready.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: One, two, three… ugh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh jeez.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle! … okay, can you put me down?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If we ever get out of here we should seriously consider joining the circus.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let me try it from behind, okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. I’m game.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ready?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ready.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: One, two, three.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, I need my right hand. Ready?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not so fun as I would have thought.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, I’m getting kind of tired or you walking all over me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s open! Okay, I think I can pull myself up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey! Let us out of here!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What do you want from us?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Captain Gates! Store owner verified he took a delivery from Spooner a couple of days ago, but he said it was just a couple of coffee tables packed near the rear of the truck.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: And you believed him?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He’s a family man, didn’t have any priors.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But he did say something happened during delivery. Something weird. As they were unloading the shipment, a box fell off a stack and hit him in the shoulder.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He said the box must have been empty because it bounced right off of him. He tried to joke with Spooner, asked him if he was shipping cotton candy or air, but Spooner kind of got squirrelly. Said it was just a couple of empties there packed there to fill some space.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He thought it wasn’t a big deal but then he heard something from behind the boxes. Something that sounded like breathing.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: So Spooner takes a few small legitimate jobs in order to justify his smuggling trips and places a wall of empties in front of whatever his real cargo is.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Did the owner have any idea where Spooner was headed?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: None.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Beckett and Castle were on to something. Where in the hell did they go?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, the only thing we had at the time was this address.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And we were already covering it.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Ah … they must have seen or heard something that you didn’t. Okay, I want you guys to –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Room clear!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Clear!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This place is empty. You really think this is where they went?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: If they were here they’re not here now.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER
utterance.content: Hey, Detective. Look in here. There’s some kind of hatch.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Damn it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s hard cased steel, Castle. We’re not getting out of these without keys.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, there is another way.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We don’t go through the cuffs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You mean –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mad Max. 127 Hours.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you offering to cut off your own hand?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa. Mine? No, I was thinking about yours.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: My hand? Why my hand?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s smaller.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They’re coming.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That sounds like Arabic.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They’re going to the other room.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, someone else is in there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They’re holding someone else.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The old woman?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No … it’s more like a girl. Like …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like they’re trying to sell her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s human trafficking, that’s what this is. Abducting and selling people. That’s why we’re still alive. They’re not going to kill us. They’re going to sell us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? I’m a bestselling author. I wonder what I’d be worth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s not find out, okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, still.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Anything?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: From the cut marks, it looks like this hatch was just installed.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Any idea why?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. CSU’s going to sweep for prints and trace. What did the neighbors say?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That the bank foreclosed on the previous owners, Bill and Nora Ranford, 6 months ago. But a couple weeks ago, new neighbors moved in.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Get an ID?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh uh. Kept a low profile. But neighbors think there were two of them, brothers, and they got an ID on their ride. Black F-150.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A black F-150? That means Beckett and Castle were here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not only that, but a couple of nights ago a guy from across the street says he hears some noises in the middle of the night so he goes to the window and sees a semi pulling up.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Spooner was here, too.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mmhmm. Whatever was going on, this was the place.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why don’t you wake up the registrar? See who bought the property. I want to know who these guys are.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hello? Can you hear us?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I can hear somebody breathing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe she’s sedated.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hello? Can you hear us?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This wall is stucco tile.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, the others are all cinderblock. If we start digging we might be able to break through and help her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How is getting out of one prison and into another going to help any of us?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, let me ask you this. If it were Alexis on the other side, what would you do?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, okay. The moment you hear. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: CSU?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Negative on prints from the house. The place was wiped. What did you get from the registrar?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, the house was foreclosed on five months ago. It’s still owned by National Bank. Our guys must have been squatting.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did you say National Bank?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yep. Why?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The files Agent Martinez sent over. Spooner made a delivery to a Brooklyn house two months ago. A couple of days later the Feds raided the place, but by then whoever was in the house was gone. All they found was a hatch cut into the floor that accessed the basement.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sounds familiar.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. And when they traced the property it was bank owned. By National Bank.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Our guys must be targeting distressed properties to run their operations from.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay, get a list of all the National Bank owned properties in the New York area, starting with the properties that have a basement. If they’re working off the National Bank foreclosure list, that might be where they’re finding their safe houses.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, that should do it. Switch.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ready.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, shift over.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Together. Ready?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve always liked your legs, but now I respect them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, yours aren’t so bad, either. You know, for the next police picnic we should do the three legged race together.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you hear us?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I guess you want to go in first?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, you go ahead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t mind if I do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: ‘kay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello? Are you there? We’re here to –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A tiger?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s a tiger. And it almost bit my face off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well you know, that explains the case and the chains and the butcher knives for the raw meat.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A tiger. That’s what they were haggling over.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, tigers are endangered. Trafficking them is illegal. We walked in on their operation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, walking in on their operation is not our problem right now. That tiger walking in here is our problem.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t worry, Castle. She’s not going to get through that wall.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey! Get back!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is it just me or does she look a little bit hungry?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s bad.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m just gonna … buy us some good will.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no, no! Castle, Don’t go near her!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s going for it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, and when she’s done with that she’ll want more.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: National Bank has close to a hundred properties in foreclosure in the outer boroughs but our folks have certain needs, so we filtered out all the ones without basements.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon, Castle. We’ve got to cover that hole. Push.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Again.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Two houses we know they used had other common elements – close freeway access, long, wide driveways that can fit a semi, and both were situated between empty lots or unoccupied houses minimizing the nosy neighbor factor.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You cross reference all that, it leaves us with 11 likelys in the outer boroughs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do we do?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Divvy up the list. Get unis out to all 11 properties and let's bring them back alive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We get in the freezer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’ll latch and we’ll suffocate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Would you rather be eaten?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I was looking for option three.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Get behind me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have a plan.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: 817 Fincher Drive. Industrial building foreclosed on 8 months ago.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Looks empty, just like the last three places.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let’s do a walk around, see if there’s anything in back.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is your plan? Do you know how high tigers can jump?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: High.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, we’re still alive, aren’t we? Okay.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Esposito, over here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Call for backup.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Remember what I said about joining the circus?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh huh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Changed my mind.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s playing with us. She’s going to knock it over. What are we going to do?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s only one thing to do. Scream like little girls.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wait, listen. You hear that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Beckett! Castle!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Esposito!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Is that a tiger?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, that’s a tiger. Hey, how ‘bout getting us out?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, hang on. We'll - we’ll be right there.

utterance.speaker: RUTH SPURLOCH
utterance.content: Drop the hardware boys, or I’ll blow you both away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Guys, open the hatch!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Put your weapon down!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It doesn’t matter which one of us you shoot first. Whoever’s left standing will kill you.

utterance.speaker: RUTH
utterance.content: Maybe I’ll shoot the pretty one first.

utterance.speaker: RUTH
utterance.content: Luckily, I don’t gotta choose.

utterance.speaker: JACK SPURLOCH
utterance.content: Y'all put ‘em down.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You first.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY SPURLOCH
utterance.content: Let’s just kill ‘em, Ma. Let Tony the tiger have at the others like we planned.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Get us outta here!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Open the door!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The stakes are considerably raised!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Your boys shoot, I swear the last thing I do is put a bullet right through your head. Your choice.

utterance.speaker: RUTH
utterance.content: You New Yorkers ain’t nearly as scary as a Texas lawman. That being said, I’m betting more of you gonna be here soon. Let me tell you what’s going to happen. Me and my boys are gonna back on outta here. You either get yourselves killed trying to stop us or you can forget all about us and you can go save your friends. That’s your choice.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m so sorry. I’ve got nothing else.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Javi?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, Castle! I did not survive a bullet to the heart to die as tiger kibble.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let ‘em go.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh God. It ate ‘em.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It didn’t eat us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But it will if you don’t hurry.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nice hangout.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER
utterance.content: Police!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Handcuffed together that long? I’m surprised you two didn’t kill each other.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, there were a couple of moments.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Until we found our rhythm.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I think we’ll fly to Florida.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I believe this is yours.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: This too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you. How did you guys –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: - even find us?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, we followed your breadcrumbs and it led us here.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: And lucky for all of us, some of my detectives keep me informed as to their whereabouts.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Thanks to you two, I’m instituting a new policy in our department. No one goes anywhere without calling it in.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thanks guys. Really appreciate that.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, at least we won’t have to look so hard the next time we save your ass.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I missed you guys.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? Prove it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, I prove it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How’s that tiger? Was it grrr-reat?

utterance.speaker: MARTINEZ
utterance.content: Her name is Ruth Spurloch and it turns out her sons were major suppliers of endangered tigers to wealthy customers all around the world.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hard to believe that’s worth killing for.

utterance.speaker: MARTINEZ
utterance.content: The exotic animal trade is a million dollar industry. Texas, which has almost no regulations, is one of the few places in the world where selling and breeding tigers isn’t illegal. Ruth and her boys were making millions off her breeding farm.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Spooner would truck them from Del Rio up to New York.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then wealthy clients would smuggle them past customs and ship them out on their private jets.

utterance.speaker: MARTINEZ
utterance.content: Right. Except outside of Texas, trafficking endangered species is a criminal offense, so Ruth didn’t want Spooner rattin' her out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which is why when we showed up at her house she played the victim so she could get the drop on us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, and knocked us out using animal tranquilizers. Which can’t be good for me. I still have a taste in my mouth.

utterance.speaker: MARTINEZ
utterance.content: Yeah. Well, I’m – I’m going to turn the trafficking case over to the FBI and Customs. You can coordinate with them on your murder charge.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Thank you, Agent Martinez. I’ll walk you out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. As expected, the hair from the truck is tiger and the blood is from raw meat.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: They used the hatches to throw down food to the cats or sedate them with darts.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s going to happen with that tiger, anyway?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Shoot ‘em.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’ll get transferred to a sanctuary.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Or that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Probably end up in a zoo. Why, you want to go visit her?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. No thanks, I’m good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, you guys. Get some rest.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That has got to be the strangest brush with death that I’ve ever had.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Me too. But I’ll tell ya. After that experience, if I ever have to be hitched to someone, it would be you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hitched?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hitched? No, I didn’t say hitched. I said cuffed. Handcuffed, not hitched, the colloquial or any connotation or meaning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s okay, Castle. I understood what you meant. And for what it’s worth, if I have to spend another night handcuffed to someone again, I wouldn’t mind if it was you, either.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But next time, let’s do it without the tiger.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Next time?
